messages.title: Election Comment
messages.content: This General Election has been called because the government has no majority in the House of Commons and therefore cannot pass legislation, including budget measures.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support leaving the EU, hopefully with a deal, but if not, believes we must still respect the 2016 referendum. Stands for the UK being able to govern itself, make its own laws, and control immigration.
Committed to the NHS, ensuring record funding over the next five years, keeping the NHS free at the point of use.
Supports the UK's 0.7% aid target, helping the world’s poorest people.
Supports measures to protect and improve animal welfare.
Strong supporter of the UK's military and armed forces.
Working on resolving traffic issues with preferred routes and consultation.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The government has no majority in the House of Commons, leading to the necessity of this General Election.

issues.brexitEurope: I support leaving the EU, hopefully with a deal, but if not, I believe we must still respect the 2016 referendum. The UK must govern itself, be able to make its own laws and control immigration. Labour can’t seem to make up their mind. Their leader has always opposed EU membership but they won’t support Brexit if you want to meet other MPs contact Laurence.
issues.defence: Strong supporter of our armed forces, and ensuring we fully fund our armed forces.
issues.environment: The diversity means the constituency needs someone experienced and ready to protect, but also to grow our environment. Committed to delivering a world-leading technology in the aerospace industry, our historic Abbey, racing industries, and much more.
issues.health: The Conservative government provided record funding for our NHS in cash terms, the highest level in history. Committed to increasing spending over the next five years, ensuring the NHS is safe in our hands.
issues.immigration: Laurence Robertson supports the UK controlling its own immigration.
issues.transport: Working on resolving the A417 Missing Link Problem with preferred routes agreed and awaiting consultation scheme by the end of 2020.

community.content: The constituency means the issue is to protect but also to grow our environment. Supporter of improving services for everyone, support for veterans, and protective legislation.

leaflet.personalStatement: Representing the Tewkesbury constituency in Parliament since 1997. Working hard to protect but also to grow our environment.

politicalExperience.achievements: Representing the constituency of Tewkesbury, protecting local interests and services.

contactInformation.address: Unit 1143 Regent Court, Gloucester Business Park, Gloucester, GL3 4AD

endorsements.endorsement: Supporting Boris as our Prime Minister.

images.caption: On a visit to commemorate the 75th anniversary of the Normandy landings.
Supporting efforts for better NHS funding.
International Development support for world's poorest people.
A campaign to make public properties more self-sufficient in electricity.

examples: The Conservative government provided record funding for our NHS in cash terms, the highest level in history.
Committed to increasing spending over the next five years.
Working hard to protect but also to grow our environment.
Strong supporter of our armed forces.
Working on resolving the A417 Missing Link Problem.
Support for local historic landmarks like the Abbey.

personalStories.story: Laurence and Annie have raised thousands of pounds for racing-related charities.

examples: Supporting Boris Johnson as our Prime Minister.
Labour can’t seem to make up their mind about Brexit.

nonPolicyAttributes.localness: Has lived in the constituency for 24 years.
nonPolicyAttributes.family: Married to Annie, enjoys reading, history, and the countryside.

examples: Has lived in the constituency for 24 years.
